item.title: Dangerous wall looking like it could collapse., 10th September
item.description:
Dangerous wall that looks like it could collapse onto the council green verge. This may be a private garden wall? However children were playing on the grass underneath this dangerous hazard, please investigate.

item.title: Disgusting rubbish left every single day HEALTH HAZARD, 10th September
item.description:
Outside 325 Upper Elmer’s End Road the pavement is being used as a dumping ground for rubbish bags, and it is now completely unacceptable. There are mountains of waste left outside which are forcing people to walk into the road to get past. Parents with buggies cannot get through and residents are having to cross or avoid the street altogether. The smell, mess and sight of it is absolutely disgusting. Foxes are constantly ripping open the rubbish bags and spreading the waste even further, and this has been happening every day for weeks. This is a health hazard, a safety issue, and a disgrace to the area. The council needs to act urgently to remove this rubbish and put measures in place to stop people dumping here in future.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop OP on Great Titchfield Street/Oxford Circus there is what appears to be dog/human fececs., 10th September
item.description:
The picture does not show it because I had to get on the bus and the original report I was doing reloaded so I longer have the picture. It is quite a lot of poo. Therefore I suspect it could be human the smell is very potent.

item.title: Sticky urine stain, 10th September
item.description:
Please clear the sticky and smelly urine stain outside intercom door. The new cleaner has only been seen once and hasnt made any effort to clean. Very minimal cleaning being done if at all. Service charges should be adjusted to reflect the reduction in service.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Dunton Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Large trees affecting the amount of sunlight the properties are getting, 10th September
item.description:
Behind our flats, mine is 193, but is affecting lots of neighbours, we have very high trees between the state and the railway. Railway. These belong to Bromley. Amount of sunlight which we get in our properties. Our properties are south facing but we have about half an hour of sunlight a day. This has been reported before and somebody came round but I would like somebody to come round and actually speak to the residents so that we can express the problems we are having.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensbourne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car rammed over post, 10th September
item.description:
White BMW drove onto the pavement and over a post. Post is now bent over in Great Portland Street on the corner of New Cavendish St W1. Thank God now one was hurt. Driver drove off. There was damage to the car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 134, Great Portland Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped mattress 3 months, 10th September
item.description:
Southwark caged van drives past every single day. Passes multiple areas of flytipped waste. What are the Southwark employees doing? Burning fumes driving all over the place not clearing the flytipped waste. Not exactly Cleaner, Greener or Safer at all. Called into enviromental services who confirmed all flytipped waste must be cleared, even those without reference numbers etc Do your job clear the mattress that has been sat on the floor behind the 2 phone boxes for months!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Dunton Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste deliberately taken out of bin, 10th September
item.description:
Location: 5 Marcia Road. The bins - number 5 and the one next to it are continuously being ransacked and the rubbish is being thrown across the front of the property and causing a concern for attracting pests. Additionally this is unhygienic. This has happened before in the last 7 days and is becoming a concern for our safety as well as it seems targeted - none of the other bins and properties seem to be experiencing this problem. Could this please be cleaned up and any advice or action regarding this problem issue please be relayed back. Thank you for your time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marcia Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle Not Road Worthy, 10th September
item.description:
Under the Refuse Disposal (Amenity) Act 1978, councils can remove vehicles that are: Left unattended for a long time Appear abandoned (e.g. flat tyres, no tax, untidy, dirty) Not in use (even if technically roadworthy) 3. Advertising Use Only If a vehicle is: Stationary for long periods Clearly not being used for transport Placed solely to display ads …it may be classed as an unauthorised advertisement, especially under the Town and Country Planning (Control of Advertisements) Regulations 2007. Legal Requirement: Under The Road Vehicles (Construction and Use) Regulations 1986, it's a legal requirement that vehicles must have: At least two mirrors (usually the driver's side mirror and either the passenger side mirror or an internal rear-view mirror). This isn't about tax or MOT. The car has not moved for months. It's in a state. it's being used as an advertising board. The car has business details written all over it - it's clearly not an active vehicle.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet
